results.title: So you're going on location
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
If pre-production meetings have been carefully enough organised then going on location should pose no problem. The location chosen is determined by the demands of the script, but before it is actually chosen permits for its use, budgetary considerations and familiarisation by the crew are essential. The film gives numerous hints for filming and graphically explains points of job allocations, camera use and lighting.

results.title: So you're getting a divorce
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Suzanne Baker and Stephen Wallace
results.brief_description: This dramatised documentary made in conjunction with the Family Court of Australia aims at assisting people considering a divorce. Showing the main functions of the Family Court, the video provides you with an understanding of these processes. It clearly explains issues such as Simple Dissolution, Conciliation Conference, Finmancial Settlements, Property, Custody and the implications of Contested Litigation.

results.title: So this Is Jollygood
results.creator_credit: W&F Film Service Ltd, Sir Michael Balcon and Tex Ringworm
results.brief_description: During one of the periodic slumps in the British Film Industry, Adrian Brunel produced several satires on “film” types. This one describes the trials of a film producer, the hunt for a financier, shows some of the “technicians” and actors (such as the great Rhubarb Vaselino), and concludes with an excerpt from the production of a harrowing drama. Other credits include: Camera artist - S.L.U. Lloyd, Electrical effects - John D’Arc, Scenario - Saimole Story.

results.title: So small my island
results.creator_credit: Henry Strauss and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: Japan is a country which is both new and old. This film shows how the traditions of Japanese life are still very much part of a nation which is also modern and industrialised. The people are hard-working, for a little land must go a long way, A love of beauty and politeness is an essential part of their lives,. Festivals, geisha girls and shrines for worship are some of the traditional aspects depicted in this beautiful country.

results.title: So much to give: a report from Anne Deveson
results.creator_credit: Pilgrim Films, Warwick Olson and Betti Wood
results.brief_description: Seeks to develop community awareness of the needs of mentally handicapped children. Shows interviews with parents, teachers, doctors and social workers involved with these children. Script and voice - Anne Deveson.

results.title: So many voices: a look at abortion in America
results.creator_credit: DHS Films, Phoenix Films and Victoria Hamburg
results.brief_description: Looks at the issue of abortion in America and the cases for and against abortion in relation to such areas as rape, incest, child abuse, mother’s health and genetic abnormalities. Note that the film is sponsored by the Naitonal Abortion Rights League Foundation Education Project in America and is pro-abortion in its approach. It is therefore strongly recommended that teachers preview the film before screening it to students. Narrated by Ed Asner and Tammy Grimes. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.title_for_label: So many voices: a look at abortion in America

results.title: So long to run
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Vladimir Valenta and Charles Lapp
results.brief_description: A woman on welfare is forced to take desperate measures to protect her children from her estranged husband and the welfare agency. The husband breaks down the door of her apartment when he suspects that she is entertaining a friend. The welfare officer threatens to remove her children if she continues to see the friend. Panic-stricken, she hides with her children in a borrowed car, but is picked up by the police.

results.title: So help me God
results.brief_description: Filmed at Campbelltown Local Court, N.S.W. it follows a number of people from their interviews with a solicitor to appearance before senior magistrate Kevin Flack. Shows the enormous workload and dedication of Legal Aid Solicitors whoo are seen advising their clients. Produced by award-winning documentary maker, Jenny Brockie, the filming took six weeks in total and the makers had secured unprecedented access to Campbelltown local court. All the defendants who feature in this program gave their written consent to be filmed. They include: Heidi - a nineteen year old mother of two, who’s been charged with receiving stolen goods; Dean - a young man charged with trying to break into a tattoo shop and trying to steal a tattoo gun; Joy - a 46 year old woman whose relatives are trying to have her put into a place of care under the Inebriates Act; Marietta - who’s seeking an order to stop her ex-husband’s girlfriend from harrassing her; Robert and Sean - who both face possible jail terms for separate offences of break, enter and steal. We also meet the major legal players at Campbelltown, the Senior Magistrate, Kevin Flack, Legal Aid lawyer - Justin Hutchinson, some private solicitors and the Police Prosecutor.

results.title: So good to share
results.creator_credit: Cinevex, Kingcroft Productions and John Kingsford-Smith
results.brief_description: Features wine and winemaking in the Barossa Valley of South Australia by German settlers in 1836. First grapes planted 1847, harvested in 1850. Views of grape picking, pressing and storage. The film shows the general life around the area.

results.title: So far from India
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair Productions and Mira Nair
results.brief_description: A documentary of the complex rhythm of middle class family life in a town in India. Tension occurs when the man, who has immigrated to New York fails to send for his family. He returns home to find many problems facing him.
results.description: A documentary of the complex rhythm of middle class family life in a town in India. Tension occurs when the man, who has immigrated to New York fails to send for his family. He returns home to find many problems facing him.
